jobs.title: Content Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We’re a startup with big ambitions: to make estate planning modern, visual, and intelligent. Vanilla is the first AI-powered estate advisory platform, built by advisors, planners, and attorneys to transform how wealth is transferred across generations. Our technology unifies scenario modeling, client visualization, and document creation into one seamless, digital experience.

Our team brings together diverse subject matter expertise across estate planning, wealth management, and scaling SaaS startups. We’re distributed across the U.S., with a mix of fully remote and hybrid roles, and we embrace flexibility while staying closely connected. At Vanilla, you’ll join curious builders and problem-solvers who thrive on speed, autonomy, and impact. Here, you won’t just join a company, you’ll help create it. If you’re excited to tackle hard problems, move quickly, and see your work shape both an industry and a growing startup, we’d love to meet you.

Job Summary

We’re looking for a Content Marketing Manager to help us scale our brand and demand-generation efforts in the wealth management technology space. This role will report directly to the Vice President of Marketing. You’ll be the engine behind our content, managing projects from concept through publication and ensuring every asset we produce drives engagement, lead generation, and brand trust among financial advisors, firms, and enterprise partners.

You’ll collaborate closely with subject matter experts, designers, and external agencies to deliver high-quality, compliant content across digital channels. This is a hands-on role for a marketer who loves turning strategy into action and maintaining operational excellence in every campaign.

Working Location

This role is a remote position, you must be based out of one of the following states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Kentucky, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington, or Washington, D.C.

Responsibilities:

  • Content Creation & Copywriting

    • Write clear, authoritative copy for blogs, email campaigns,webpages, and digital ads tailored to financial advisors and wealth management leaders.

    • Partner with Sr. Brand Marketing Manager to develop content supporting thought leadership initiatives (e.g. white papers, client stories, speaker abstracts).

    • Repurpose long-form content (e.g., webinars, white papers) into shorter assets for use across multiple channels.

    • Collaborate with internal stakeholders and SEO agencies to research keywords, optimize existing content, and identify new content opportunities.

    • Ensure all content adheres to SEO best practices and supports inbound traffic and conversion goals.

  • Content Operations & Project Management

    • Align with Sr. Brand Marketing Manager to maintain a content calendar, ensuring consistent execution across campaigns and initiatives.

    • Coordinate content production across internal teams and agency partners to ensure on-time delivery.

    • Upload and format web and blog content in WordPress, ensuring brand and SEO consistency.

    • Track and report on content performance, engagement, and conversion metrics to inform ongoing strategy.

  • Social Media & Community Engagement

    • Develop and publish posts across LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and industry communities to build brand awareness and authority.

    • Collaborate with design to produce visually engaging, on-brand content.

    • Engage directly with influencers, clients, and prospects to amplify reach and foster relationships within the advisor and fintech ecosystem.

  • Webinar Management

    • Manage webinar content, logistics, timelines, and cross-team deliverables.

    • Coordinate pre- and post-event marketing, including promotions, follow-ups, and on-demand content.

    • Partner with go-to-market teams to align webinar topics with pipeline and retention goals.

Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in content marketing, preferably within B2B SaaS, fintech or wealthtech.

  • Exceptional writing and editing skills, with the ability to translate complex financial and technology concepts into clear, engaging content.

  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines.

  • Familiarity with tools such as WordPress, HubSpot (or similar CRM/marketing automation platforms), Google Analytics, and social scheduling tools.

  • Understanding of SEO, lead nurturing, and content performance metrics.

  • Comfortable working in a regulated or compliance-conscious industry (wealth management or financial services experience is a plus).

  • Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship now or in the future. Vanilla is unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time.

What Success Looks Like:

  • A consistent, high-quality publishing cadence across web, email, and social channels.

  • Increased inbound traffic and engagement from target advisor and enterprise audiences.

  • On-time execution of campaigns, webinars, and content initiatives.

  • Strong collaboration and communication across marketing, design, and revenue teams.

The salary range for this role is $75,000 to $90,000. Our compensation packages also include a performance based bonus and equity. Compensation is based on a number of factors and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Benefits:

  • Flexible paid time off policy and 10 company-wide paid holidays 

  • Parental leave, 4 weeks for all full-time employees and up to 12 weeks for birthing parents

  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits coverage for employees and their families 

  • 401K eligibility after one month of employment

  • Free estate planning documents

  • Budget for learning & development and home office setup 

  • Paid parking or transit for hybrid and in office employees 

Vanilla Technologies Inc. (dba "Vanilla") provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Vanilla participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We’re a startup with big ambitions: to make estate planning modern, visual, and intelligent. Vanilla is the first AI-powered estate advisory platform, built by advisors, planners, and attorneys to transform how wealth is transferred across generations. Our technology unifies scenario modeling, client visualization, and document creation into one seamless, digital experience.

Our team brings together diverse subject matter expertise across estate planning, wealth management, and scaling SaaS startups. We’re distributed across the U.S., with a mix of fully remote and hybrid roles, and we embrace flexibility while staying closely connected. At Vanilla, you’ll join curious builders and problem-solvers who thrive on speed, autonomy, and impact. Here, you won’t just join a company, you’ll help create it. If you’re excited to tackle hard problems, move quickly, and see your work shape both an industry and a growing startup, we’d love to meet you.

Working Location

This role is a remote position, you must be based out of one of the following states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Virginia, or Washington.

**Preference for candidates based in Central or Eastern timezones

Job Summary

As the Engineering Manager at Vanilla, you will lead a dynamic team of engineers, provide technical direction, foster collaboration across various teams within the company and support the professional growth of your team members. This role demands a leader with a solid technical foundation, outstanding leadership abilities, and a passion for nurturing innovation in a fast-paced, start-up environment.

Responsibilities 

  • Drive technical and product strategy by aligning engineering execution with the company's broader business goals and customer needs. You’ll help architect solutions that scale both technically and operationally.

  • Lead end-to-end delivery, balancing speed with technical quality. You bring clarity to complexity and champion scalable design principles.

  • Act as a key operational leader, implementing systems, tools, and processes that improve development velocity, quality, and collaboration across teams.

  • Mentor and grow high-performing engineers, supporting their professional development and creating a culture of accountability, autonomy, and learning.

  • Serve as a critical cross-functional partner, working with product, design, marketing, sales, and support to align roadmaps, unblock execution, and ensure customer-centric product outcomes.

  • Support pre-sales conversations and customer onboarding, helping technical stakeholders understand product capabilities and ensuring feedback loops from the field inform our roadmap.

  • Coordinate external integrations and platform partnerships, managing stakeholder expectations and ensuring secure, seamless implementation.

  • Define and own engineering metrics and KPIs to drive continuous improvement in product quality, team performance, and operational efficiency.

  • Collaborate with Legal and Security teams to uphold compliance, privacy, and regulatory standards across all systems.

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of professional engineering experience, with 3+ years in an engineering management role or technical program management role.

  • A track record of building and scaling complex software systems at high-growth SaaS companies or startups.

  • Strong operational instincts, you’re process-oriented, data-driven, and focused on systems that enable high-leverage execution.

  • Experience influencing product architecture and engineering strategy through a systems-thinking lens.

  • Comfort navigating ambiguity and working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

  • Strong communication and leadership skills, you excel at guiding technical discussions and aligning diverse stakeholders.

  • Prior experience in pre-sales engineering roles is highly valued.

  • Project management experience, particularly in fast-paced or cross-functional environments, is a strong plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.

Benefits:

  • Flexible paid time off policy and 10 company-wide paid holidays 

  • Parental leave, 4 weeks for all full-time employees and up to 12 weeks for birthing parents

  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits coverage for employees and their families 

  • 401K eligibility after one month of employment

  • Free estate planning documents

  • Budget for learning & development and home office setup 

  • Paid parking or transit for hybrid and in office employees

Vanilla participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.
